name: Ayam Masak Lemak (Indonesian Chicken Stew)
author: Madhur Jaffrey
source: A Taste of the Far East, pg.298
ingredients:
- 1.5kg chicken, cut into 10 pieces
- 2 tsp tamarind paste
- salt
- 1 small green pepper, coarsely chopped
- 12 fresh, hot green chillies, sliced
- 2 small onions, coarsely chopped
- 5 cloves garlic
- 1 tomato (150g)
- 1 stick of lemongrass (or 1 tsp lemongrass powder)
- 150ml vegetable oil
- 4 kaffir lime leaves (fresh or dried)
instructions:
- Put the chicken in a bowl. Combine the tamarind astte with 1 tsp salt and 2 tbsp water in a cup. Mix and pour over the chicken. Rub it in and leave for 30 minutes.

- Put the green pepper, chillies, onion garlic and tomato into a blender - blend until you have a paste.
- Cut and discard the top of the lemongrass, crush the bottom lightly.
- Heat the oil int a large frying pan over a high heat. When hot, add the chicken and its marinade. Brown the chicken on both sides, and remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
- Remove half the oil, and add the paste from the blender, the lemongrass and the kaffir lime leaves. Stir and fry for 6-7 minutes until the paste is nicely browned.
- Now put in the chicken, 300ml water and 1/2 tsp salt. Bring to a boil.
- Cover, turn the heat to low and gently simmer for 25 minutes, stirring and turning over the chicken occasionally.
